text:
Hey guys, it's Ro, welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today we are going to be making something
that we've never made before: We are going
to be making gummies!

I learned how to make gummies when I was on
the set of "Feast Of Fiction".

Jimmy Wong and Ashley taught me how to make
Lego Gummies, it was so much fun.

I'll put a link down below so you can check
out the video if you missed it!

The recipe was so good that I wanted to share
it with you all, so today I'm gonna be making
Bejeweled Gummies!
Let's get started!

The things you will need will be a big pot,
some unflavored gelatin, and we're gonna need
six Jell-O flavors.

You're gonna need Red, Orange, Yellow, Green,
Blue, Purple and then for the clear gems,

you're just gonna use the regular gelatin
and we'll have to add a little flavor.

Anything that is a clear-flavoring will be
fine.
I've got two options here. I

I've got "Cotton Candy" or "Pineapple", whatever
flavoring you'd like, we'll use that.

And then you're gonna need gem-molds, I
just found these at the store, but if you

can't find them at the store, I'll put a link
down below so you can find it online.
Take a look at that!
They look just like the game!

You'll also need 1/2 a Cup measuring cup,
a baster, and a bunch of bowls to mix our Jell-O up!
Let's put it all together!

The first thing that you're gonna do is separate
all your different gem-gummy colors by Jell-O.

Everybody gets their own bowl so you have
a little Jell-O Packet and then 3 gelatins.

First we're gonna add our 3 packs of gelatin,
then we're gonna add our Jell-O Pack...

Then you're gonna take a spoon, mix it all
around...
Then you're gonna-ha-add 1/2 a Cup of water...

Eeeeuuuhh don't drop it, don't drop it, don't
drop it!
Eeeewwwuh- I'm so buff, I'm so buff!
Then mix it around again!

After you've mixed up the red one, now you're
just gonna do this to all of your other colors,

and your clear one we're gonna do something
a little bit different, you're gonna add 6

packs of gelatin, 1/2 a Cup of water and a
teaspoon or tablespoon if you want a LOT of

flavor of whatever little flavoring you'd
like!
I'm choosing "Cotton Candy"!

Now that we've got all of our Jell-O's mixed
up, they're nice and thick!

Even our little white, clear one- Look at
that!

Really thick, it should feel like mashed potatoes,
you're gonna get your pot, fill it with some
water and head over to the stove.

Fill your pot with about an inch and a half
of water and bring to a boil.

Then, place the bowl of gelatin into the pot
and stir with a spoon until it dissolves.
'til it's all liquid!

When a layer of foam begins to spread across
the top, it is done!

Remove the pot from the heat and grab your
baster.

You're gonna use the baster to transfer the
mix into your gem-molds.

It's really, really handy 'cuz it's gonna
bypass all the foam on the top and you're
gonna get that clear color from the bottom!

Fill all your molds and pop them into the
freezer for about 15 minutes to set.

Once your molds have set, you're just gonna
pop 'em out and they'll look like this.
Dew-doooooooo!
It's super easy, I'll show you how to do it.
So you have a mold just like that...

...they're very durable, but I always am a
little bit gentle, just take a corner...
...and pull 'em out!
A little Jell-O Jiggler!

I'm putting these little gummies on a piece
of wax-paper because I'm gonna cut them to
be a closer shape to the actual game.

For little purple gummies, I'm gonna cut them
to look like a triangle, so I'm just gonna
cut off the top of the gem, perfect!

Then for the green gummies, I'm gonna cut
each corner at a diagonal, just a little bit!

Then I'm gonna do the same thing to these
little white ones.
Ta-daaaa!

Here are The Bejeweled Jell-O Gummies that
we made!
I hope you guys liked 'em!

Again, I'll put the recipe down below- I learned
this from "Feast OF Fiction".

I had so much fun with them and I hope you
guys enjoy it!

If you have any other suggestions for any
other Nerdy Nummies, please let me know!

Leave me your comment down below...put it
down 'dhere!
And I'll do my best to make it happen!

Also, you can follow me on Facebook, Twitter,
Tumblr, Instagram...

I'll post lots of pictures of these yummy
little gummies and if you guys create these,

I love to see your baking creations so please
send them to me!
I get a big kick out of it!
All right, thanks again you guys! Bye-bye!
